00023 // =============================================================================
00024 // constructor
00025 Generator :: Generator(SystemPtr o)
00026     // references cannot be assigned implicitly; must initialize
00027     : sys_(o), // initialize
00028     // default polySize is one
00029       polySize_(1)
00030 
00031 {
00032     Generator::init();
00033 }
00034 
00035 
00036 // =============================================================================
00037 // destructor
00038 Generator :: ~Generator()
00039 {
00040     for (int i = 0; i < localGenerators_.size(); ++i) {
00041         // here, use -> on smart pointer to access method
00042         if (aw::PRINT_LOG) {
00043             std::clog<< "destroying a local generator: " << i << " name: " << localGenerators_[i]->getName() << std::endl;
00044         }
00045         // here, use dot operator on pointer
00046         localGenerators_[i].reset();
00047     }
00048 }

00050 // =============================================================================
00051 void Generator :: init()
00052 {    
00053     gt_ = aw::gTypeMono;
00054     // for Generators, connect the working value to the pointer; this is only
00055     // present to simulate PolyGenerator behavior. 
00056     workingValuePtr_ = &workingValue_;
00057 }

00085 // =============================================================================
00086 std::string Generator :: getParameterString(bool compact)
00087 {
00088     // "refresh{30}{frequency}"
00089     std::string str;
00090 
00091     str += getName();
00092     str += "{";
00093     
00094     //result = std::find(pValid_.begin(), pValid_.end(), p);
00095     for (ParameterNameVector::iterator it = pValid_.begin(); 
00096         it != pValid_.end(); 
00097         ++it)  // need to pre-increment here
00098     {
00099         //std::cout << *it << std::endl;
00100         // parameter names are actually just Integers, as the are defined
00101         // in an enum; need to convert
00102         str += aw::parameterNameToString(*it); // dereference string
00103         str += "{";
00104         // provide value set to this Parmeter
00105         //GeneratorPtr subParameter = getParameter(*it);
00106 
00107         str += getParameter(*it)->getParameterString(compact);
00108         // str += pMap_[*it]->getName();
00109         str += "}";
00110 
00111         // might only show context if it is not none
00112         aw::ParameterContext localContext = getContext(*it);
00113         
00114         if (localContext != aw::pContextNameNone) {
00115             str += "{";
00116             str += aw::parameterContextToString(localContext);
00117             str += "}";
00118         }
00119     }
00120     str += "}";
00121 
00122     return str;
00123 }

00126 // =============================================================================
00127 bool Generator :: isValidParameter(const aw::ParameterName p)
00128 {
00129     ParameterNameVector::iterator result;
00130     // find the parameter in the vector of parameters
00131     result = std::find(pValid_.begin(), pValid_.end(), p);
00132     if(result == pValid_.end()) return false;
00133     return true;
00134 }

00136 // =============================================================================
00137 bool Generator :: isValidGenerator(const aw::ParameterName p, 
00138                                    aw::GeneratorType gt)
00139 {
00140     if (pTypeMap_[p] == gt) return true;
00141     return false;
00142 }

00144 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00145 bool Generator :: isValidGenerator(const aw::ParameterName p, GeneratorPtr g)
00146 {
00147     // call alternate form
00148     return isValidGenerator(p, g->getGeneratorType());

00153 // =============================================================================
00154 // a result is given whether or not this Generator or Generator subclass supports this particular parameter. 
00155 // this could be moved into Common?
00156 bool Generator :: isValidContext(const aw::ParameterName p,
00157                                            aw::ParameterContext pc)
00158 {
00159     switch (p) {                       
00160         case aw::pNameValue:       
00161             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00162             else return false;
00163 
00164         case aw::pNameRefresh:       
00165             switch (pc) {     
00166                 case aw::pContextNameFrequency:
00167                     return true;
00168                 case aw::pContextNamePeriodSeconds:
00169                     return true;
00170                 case aw::pContextNamePeriodSamples:
00171                     return true;
00172                 case aw::pContextNameTrigger:
00173                     return true;
00174                 case aw::pContextNameBeatsPerMinute:
00175                     return true;
00176                 default: return false;
00177             };
00178 
00179         case aw::pNameRate:       
00180             switch (pc) {     
00181                 case aw::pContextNameFrequency:
00182                     return true;
00183                 case aw::pContextNamePeriodSeconds:
00184                     return true;
00185                 case aw::pContextNamePeriodSamples:
00186                     return true;
00187                 case aw::pContextNamePitch:
00188                     return true;
00189                 case aw::pContextNameBeatsPerMinute:
00190                     return true;
00191                 default: return false;
00192             };
00193 
00194         case aw::pNameDutyCycle:       
00195             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00196             else return false;
00197 
00198         case aw::pNameMinimum:       
00199             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00200             else return false;
00201 
00202         case aw::pNameMaximum:                         
00203             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00204             else return false;
00205 
00206         case aw::pNameOperand1:                         
00207             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00208             else return false;
00209 
00210         case aw::pNameOperand2:                         
00211             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00212             else return false;
00213 
00214         case aw::pNameOperand3:                         
00215             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00216             else return false;
00217 
00218         case aw::pNameOperand4:                         
00219             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00220             else return false;
00221 
00222         // could have context in unitInterval or dB
00223         case aw::pNameAmplitude:                         
00224             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00225             else return false;
00226 
00227         case aw::pNameValueList:                         
00228             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00229             else return false;
00230 
00231         case aw::pNameSelectionMethod:                         
00232             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00233             else return false;
00234 
00235         // contexts might be unitInterval (0-1), mirrorUnitInterval()
00236         // mirror percent (-100 to 100)?
00237         case aw::pNamePanLeftRight:                         
00238             if (pc == aw::pContextNameNone) return true;
00239             else return false;
00240 
00241     } // end case   
00242     return false;   
00243 }

00284 // =============================================================================
00285 
00286 void Generator :: setParameter(const aw::ParameterName p, 
00287                                GeneratorPtr g, 
00288                                aw::ParameterContext pc)
00289 {
00290     // first, make sure this is a valid parameter
00291     if (!isValidParameter(p)) {
00292         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid parameter for this generator: " + getName());
00293     }
00294     if (!isValidContext(p, pc)) {
00295         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid context for this generator");
00296     }
00297     // check that a valid generator type is being provided
00298     if (!isValidGenerator(p, g->getGeneratorType())) {
00299         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid generator type for this parameter: " + aw::parameterNameToString(p));
00300     }
00301 
00302     pMap_[p] = g;
00303     // for many parameters this may be none
00304     pContextMap_[p] = pc; 
00305 } 
00306 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00307 // this is only done for parameter values that are provided as doubles, not for parameter values that are provided by Generators. 
00308 void Generator :: setParameter(const aw::ParameterName p, 
00309                                double v, 
00310                                aw::ParameterContext pc)
00311 {
00312     // create a local generator
00313     ConstantPtr g(new Constant(sys_));
00314     // p1 = new Constant(sys_);
00315     g->setParameter(aw::pNameValue, v);
00316     localGenerators_.push_back(g);
00317     // set the parameter here
00318     // call version with Generator: in derived class!
00319 
00320     if (aw::PRINT_LOG) {
00321         std::clog<< "calling base class setParameter with a double: " << v << " name: " << g->getName() << std::endl;
00322         }
00323 
00324     setParameter(p, g, pc);
00325 }
00326 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00327 // vector loading version
00328 void Generator :: setParameter(const aw::ParameterName p, 
00329                                   std::vector<double>& v, 
00330                                   aw::ParameterContext pc)
00331 {
00332     // create a local generator
00333     PolyConstantPtr g(new PolyConstant(sys_));
00334     // calls overridden method
00335     g->setParameter(aw::pNameValue, v);
00336     localGenerators_.push_back(g);
00337     // set the parameter here
00338     // call version with Generator: in derived class!
00339 
00340     if (aw::PRINT_LOG) {
00341         std::clog<< "calling base class setParameter with a vector: name: " << g->getName() << std::endl;
00342         }
00343     // possibly need to do dynamic cast here?
00344     setParameter(p, g, pc);
00345 }

00408 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00409 // all string passed by reference
00410 // strings here should be const?
00411 // PolyConstant overload this form
00412 void Generator :: setParameter(std::string& pString, 
00413                                std::string& generatorString, 
00414                                std::string& pcString)
00415 {
00416     std::string name(""); 
00417     std::string arguments("");
00418     std::string context("");
00419     std::string working("");
00420 
00421     //std::cout << "Generator.setParameter(): pString: " << pString << std::endl;
00422     //std::cout << "Generator.setParameter(): generatorString: " << generatorString << std::endl;
00423 
00424     aw::getFirstParameterTrio(generatorString, name, arguments, context,
00425                               working);
00426 
00427     // call create from GeneratorFactory
00428     GeneratorFactory gf(sys_); // one instance
00429     GeneratorPtr g = gf.create(generatorString);
00430 
00431     // pass on to whichever method is appropriate
00432     // if this is Constant, may call a overridden method
00433     setParameter(aw::stringToParameterName(pString), 
00434                 g, 
00435                 aw::stringToParameterContext(pcString));
00436 }

00438 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00439 // all char array version
00440 // PolyConstant overload this form
00441 void Generator :: setParameter(char* const pCharArray, 
00442                                char* const generatorCharArray, 
00443                                char* const pcCharArray)
00444 {
00445     std::string pString(pCharArray);
00446     std::string generatorString(generatorCharArray);
00447     std::string pcString(pcCharArray);
00448     // character arrays are converted to strings
00449     setParameter(pString, 
00450                  generatorString, 
00451                  pcString);
00452 }

00458 // =============================================================================
00459 // this is called from GeneratorFactory.create
00460 void Generator :: readParameterString(std::string& parameterString) {
00461 
00462     std::string str(parameterString); // get a copy of this string
00463 
00464     // read in parameters in a loop
00465     while (str != "") {
00466         std::string name(""); 
00467         std::string arguments("");
00468         std::string context("");
00469         std::string working("");
00470 
00471         // set name, etc from values in str
00472         //std::cout << "Generator.readParameterString(): " << str << std::endl;
00473 
00474         aw::getFirstParameterTrio(str, name, arguments, context, working);
00475         // std::cout << "name: " << name << std::endl;
00476         // std::cout << "arguments: " << arguments << std::endl;
00477 
00478         // look here for arguments that are simply numbers: these
00479         // are Constant objects, and should be created here (simply by using setParameter and a number for arguments!
00480         bool pStrIsDoubleArgs = aw::canConvertFromStringToDouble(arguments); 
00481         bool pStrIsVectorDoubleArgs = aw::canConvertFromStringToVectorDouble(
00482             arguments); 
00483 
00484         if (pStrIsDoubleArgs) {
00485             //std::cout << "Generator.readParameterString(): evaluating args as double" << std::endl;
00486             setParameter(name, aw::stringToDouble(arguments), context);
00487         }
00488         else if (pStrIsVectorDoubleArgs) {
00489             //std::cout << "Generator.readParameterString(): evaluating args as vector double" << std::endl;
00490 
00491             std::vector<double> v = aw::stringToVectorDouble(arguments);
00492             setParameter(aw::stringToParameterName(name),
00493                          v, 
00494                          aw::stringToParameterContext(context));
00495         }
00496         else {
00497         // names here are parameter names; as strings, these will be converted
00498         // this calls the all-string version of this, only on non Constant gens
00499         // arguments may define other internal Generators
00500             setParameter(name, arguments, context);
00501         }
00502 
00503 //         std::cout << "got name, arguments, context: " << name << ": " << arguments << ": " << context << ": " << std::endl;
00504 //         std::cout << "got working: " << working << std::endl;
00505 
00506         str.clear();
00507         str.append(working); // append the remaining parameters
00508     }
00509 }

00514 // =============================================================================
00515 double Generator :: getValueWithContextToFrequency(double v, 
00516                     aw::ParameterName pn, 
00517                     aw::SampleRateType sr)
00518 {
00519     switch (pContextMap_[pn]) {       
00520         case aw::pContextNameFrequency:
00521             // do nothing
00522             break;
00523         case aw::pContextNamePeriodSeconds:
00524             // convert from period to frequency
00525             v = 1.0 / v;
00526             break;
00527         case aw::pContextNamePeriodSamples:
00528             // convert from period in samples to frequency
00529             v = 1.0 / aw::sampleTimeToSecondTime(v);
00530             break;
00531         case aw::pContextNamePitch:
00532             // convert from midi pitch to fq
00533             v = 440.0 * pow(2, ((v-69)/12.0));
00534             break;
00535         case aw::pContextNameBeatsPerMinute:
00536             // convert from period in samples to frequency
00537             v = 1.0 / aw::bpmToSecondTime(v);
00538             break;
00539     };
00540     return v;
00541 }    
00542 
00543 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00544 double Generator :: getValueWithContextToPeriodSamples(double v, 
00545                     aw::ParameterName pn, 
00546                     aw::SampleRateType sr)
00547 {
00548     // the context of the input value is determined by the context alone
00549     // whatever the context, return the value in sample
00550     switch (pContextMap_[pn]) {       
00551         case aw::pContextNameFrequency:
00552             // from fq to period in samples
00553             v = aw::secondTimeToSampleTime(1./v, sr);
00554             break;
00555         case aw::pContextNamePeriodSeconds:
00556             // from seconds to samples
00557             v = aw::secondTimeToSampleTime(v, sr);
00558             break;
00559         case aw::pContextNamePeriodSamples:
00560             break; // nothing to do!
00561         case aw::pContextNameTrigger:
00562             if (v != 0) {
00563                 v = 1;
00564                 }
00565             else {
00566                 // not sure if this is the best approach
00567                 v = LONG_MAX;
00568             }
00569             break;
00570         case aw::pContextNamePitch:
00571             // convert from midi pitch to fq, then fq to period in samples
00572             v = 440.0 * pow(2, ((v-69)/12.0));
00573             v = aw::secondTimeToSampleTime(1./v, sr);
00574             break;
00575 
00576         case aw::pContextNameBeatsPerMinute:
00577             v = aw::secondTimeToSampleTime(aw::bpmToSecondTime(v), sr);
00578             break;
00579 
00580 
00581     };
00582     return v;
00583 }

00593 // =============================================================================
00594 double Generator :: getValueAtSecond(double secondTime)
00595 {
00596     // std::cout << "calling base class getValueAtSecond" << std::endl;
00597     return getValueAtSample(aw::secondTimeToSampleTime(secondTime, 
00598                             sys_->getSamplingRate()));
00599 }

00604 // =============================================================================
00605 double* Generator :: getPolyAtSample(aw::SampleTimeType st)
00606 {
00607     // call get value to set working value ptr
00608     workingValue_ = getValueAtSample(st);
00609     return workingValuePtr_;
00610 }

00617                             sys_->getSamplingRate()));
00618 }

00646 // =============================================================================
00649 
00650 void Generator :: printSample(int n, double t, int scalar, aw::TimeContext tc)
00651 {
00652     //std::cout << "calling printSample from within Generator: " << this->getName() << std::endl;
00653 
00654     double v;     
00655     std::vector<double> values; // store values
00656     for (int i=0; i < n*scalar; i++) { 
00657         switch (tc) {                       
00658             case aw::timeContextNameSample:       
00659                 v = getValueAtSample(t+i); // adds to stream
00660                 break;              
00661             case aw::timeContextNameSecond:                         
00662                 v = getValueAtSecond(t+i); // adds to stream
00663                 break;              
00664         }; // end case    
00665         if (i % scalar == 0) values.push_back(v); 
00666     };
00667     aw::printVector(values, getName());
00668 }

00672 // =============================================================================
00674 
00675 void Generator :: printParameterDiagnostic()
00676 {
00677     ParameterGeneratorMap::iterator p;
00678 
00679     std::clog<< "// parameter diagnostic: pMap_" << std::endl;
00680     for(p = pMap_.begin(); p != pMap_.end(); p++) {
00681         std::clog << "// key: " << p->first;
00682         std::clog << " // Generator name: " << p->second->getName();
00683         std::clog << " // sample value: " << p->second->getValueAtSample(0) << std::endl;
00684     }
00685 
00686     ParameterContextMap::iterator r;
00687 
00688     std::clog<< "// parameter diagnostic: pContextMap_" << std::endl;
00689     for(r = pContextMap_.begin(); r != pContextMap_.end(); r++) {
00690         std::clog << "// key: " << r->first;
00691         std::clog << " // value: " << r->second<< std::endl;
00692     }
00693 
00694     GeneratorVector::iterator s;
00695 
00696     std::clog<< "// parameter diagnostic: localGenerators_" << std::endl;
00697     for(s = localGenerators_.begin(); s != localGenerators_.end(); s++) {
00698         std::clog << "// Generator name: " << (*s)->getName();
00699         std::clog << " // sample value: " << (*s)->getValueAtSample(0) << std::endl;
00700     }
00701 }
